dict.string: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
Ayn Rand
A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
Colin Powell
A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
Yoko Ono
A gentle word, a kind look, a good-natured smile can work wonders and accomplish miracles.
William Hazlitt
A good idea is about ten percent and implementation and hard work, and luck is 90 percent.
Guy Kawasaki
A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.
Brad Henry
A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
Albert Schweitzer
A healthy attitude is contagious but don't wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.
Tom Stoppard
A healthy vision of the future is not possible without an accurate knowledge of the past.
Daisaku Ikeda
A man only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.
Will Rogers
A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
Jean de La Fontaine
A positive attitude can really make dreams come true - it did for me.
David Bailey
A positive attitude is something everyone can work on, and everyone can learn how to employ it.
Joan Lunden
A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.
Marcel Proust
A rejection is nothing more than a necessary step in the pursuit of success.
Bo Bennett
A single conversation across the table with a wise man is better than ten years mere study of books.
Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
A speculator is a man who observes the future, and acts before it occurs.
Bernard Baruch
A strong positive mental attitude will create more miracles than any wonder drug.
Patricia Neal
A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
Joyce Brothers
A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
David Brinkley
A writer should have the precision of a poet and the imagination of a scientist.
Vladimir Nabokov
Adopting the right attitude can convert a negative stress into a positive one.
Hans Selye
Advise for anybody - enjoy what you are doing, enjoy the process of learning and don't be impatient.
Robin Cousins
All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
Walt Disney
All you need is ignorance and confidence and the success is sure.
Mark Twain
All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
Earl Nightingale
Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
Abraham Lincoln
Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
Og Mandino
Always remember that striving and struggle precede success, even in the dictionary.
Sarah Ban Breathnach
An idea isn't worth much until a man is found who has the energy and ability to make it work.
William Feather
An intelligent person is never afraid or ashamed to find errors in his understanding of things.
Bryant H. McGill
Anytime you ride against the best in the world, it becomes a learning process.
Bonnie Blair
Art has the power to transform, to illuminate, to educate, inspire and motivate.
Harvey Fierstein
As you grow in this business, you learn how to do more with less.
Morgan Freeman
Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer, and practice it.
Richard Bach
Be as smart as you can, but remember that it is always better to be wise than to be smart.
Alan Alda
Be good. Do good. The devil wields no power over a good man.
Harry Segall
Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.
Wayne Dyer
Be what you are. This is the first step toward becoming better than you are.
Julius Charles Hare
Become a student of change. It is the only thing that will remain constant.
Anthony J. D'Angelo
Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
Simone de Beauvoir
Change, like sunshine, can be a friend or a foe, a blessing or a curse, a dawn or a dusk.
William Arthur Ward
Children have neither a past nor a future. Thus they enjoy the present, which seldom happens to us.
Jean de la Bruyere
Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Confucius
Circumstances are beyond human control, but our conduct is in our own power.
Benjamin Disraeli
Confidence comes from hours and days and weeks and years of constant work and dedication.
Roger Staubach
Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
Winston Churchill
Courage consists not in blindly overlooking danger, but in seeing it, and conquering it.
Jean Paul
Courage is not the absence of despair it is, rather, the capacity to move ahead in spite of despair.
Rollo May
Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
Winston Churchill
Defeat is not the worst of failures. Not to have tried is the true failure.
George Edward Woodberry
Design can have such a positive impact on the way people live and on their relationships and moods.
Genevieve Gorder
Develop a passion for learning. If you do, you will never cease to grow.
Anthony J. D'Angelo
Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
Buddha
Do not pray for tasks equal to your powers. Pray for powers equal to your tasks.
Phillips Brooks
Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
Thomas Jefferson
Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.
Andrew Carnegie
Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.
Elbert Hubbard
Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.
Oprah Winfrey
Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.
John Wooden
Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
Robert Louis Stevenson
Don't think of it as failure. Think of it as time-released success.
Robert Orben
Don't you dare underestimate the power of your own instinct.
Barbara Corcoran
Dream and give yourself permission to envision a You that you choose to be.
Joy Page
Dream as if you'll live forever. Live as if you'll die today.
James Dean
Dream no small dreams for they have no power to move the hearts of men.
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Education is not only a ladder of opportunity, but it is also an investment in our future.
Ed Markey
Education is the investment our generation makes in the future.
Mitt Romney
Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
Nelson Mandela
Education is the passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
Malcolm X
Education, therefore, is a process of living and not a preparation for future living.
John Dewey
Effective communication is 20% what you know and 80% how you feel about what you know.
Jim Rohn
Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
Napoleon Hill
Either positive or negative comments are good because it shows I am still relevant.
Justin Guarini
Endurance is nobler than strength, and patience than beauty.
John Ruskin
Enjoy failure and learn from it. You can never learn from success.
James Dyson
Even though the future seems far away, it is actually beginning right now.
Mattie Stepanek
Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.
John Dewey
Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
Leo Tolstoy
Excellent firms don't believe in excellence - only in constant improvement and constant change.
Tom Peters
Expect the best. Prepare for the worst. Capitalize on what comes.
Zig Ziglar
Failure doesn't mean you are a failure it just means you haven't succeeded yet.
Robert H. Schuller
Failure is not our only punishment for laziness there is also the success of others.
Jules Renard
Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
Henry Ford
Failure is the key to success each mistake teaches us something.
Morihei Ueshiba
Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
Og Mandino
Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
Theodore Roosevelt
Football taught me how hard you had to work to achieve something.
Kenny Chesney
For true success ask yourself these four questions: Why? Why not? Why not me? Why not now?
James Allen
Fortune cookies are a good idea. If the message is positive, it can make your day a little better.
Yao Ming
Future orientation is combined with a notion and expectation of progress, and nothing is impossible.
Alan Dundes
Genius is the ability to put into effect what is on your mind.
F. Scott Fitzgerald
Give me a couple of years, and I'll make that actress an overnight success.
Samuel Goldwyn
Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?
Eliza Dushku
Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
Henry David Thoreau
Goals allow you to control the direction of change in your favor.
Brian Tracy
Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
Plato
Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
St. Jerome
Great is the power of habit. It teaches us to bear fatigue and to despise wounds and pain.
Marcus Tullius Cicero
Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
Samuel Johnson
Happiness is inward, and not outward and so, it does not depend on what we have, but on what we are.
Henry Van Dyke
Happiness is mostly a by-product of doing what makes us feel fulfilled.
Benjamin Spock
Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind.
Daphne du Maurier
Happiness is not a reward - it is a consequence. Suffering is not a punishment - it is a result.
Robert Green Ingersoll
Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.
Margaret Lee Runbeck
Happiness is not something you postpone for the future it is something you design for the present.
Jim Rohn
Happiness is perfume, you can't pour it on somebody else without getting a few drops on yourself.
James Van Der Zee
Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
Franklin D. Roosevelt
Hard work without talent is a shame, but talent without hard work is a tragedy.
Robert Half
He that fails in his endeavors after wealth or power will not long retain either honesty or courage.
Samuel Johnson
He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
Muhammad Ali
I always prefer to believe the best of everybody, it saves so much trouble.
Rudyard Kipling
I am a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
Stephen Leacock
I am blood type O-positive, which I remember by staying 'optimistic positive.'
Michael Weatherly
I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination.
Albert Einstein
I am not afraid of storms for I am learning how to sail my ship.
Louisa May Alcott
I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
Florence Nightingale
I believe in the imagination. What I cannot see is infinitely more important than what I can see.
Duane Michals
I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
Jimmy Dean
I couldn't find the sports car of my dreams, so I built it myself.
Ferdinand Porsche
I do the very best I know how - the very best I can and I mean to keep on doing so until the end.
Abraham Lincoln
I don't know what the future may hold, but I know who holds the future.
Ralph Abernathy
I have always had the courage for the new things that life sometimes offers.
Wallis Simpson
I have an idea of who I want to be, I have a vision of my own success.
Wiz Khalifa
I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
Thomas A. Edison
I haven't been faithful to my own advice in the past. I will in the future.
Billy Graham
I just need to know that I did the very best I could and that I was true to myself.
Lenny Kravitz
I love learning, and I think that curiosity is a wonderful gift.
Andie MacDowell
I never learn anything talking. I only learn things when I ask questions.
Lou Holtz
I put my heart and my soul into my work, and have lost my mind in the process.
Vincent Van Gogh
I started the site when I was 19. I didn't know much about business back then.
Mark Zuckerberg
I think anytime you can affect people in general, in a positive way, then you're a lucky individual.
Sam Elliott
I think if you just look at life in a positive way, positive things will happen.
Jake Owen
I think that the best training a top manager can be engaged in is management by example.
Carlos Ghosn
I think you can have 10,000 explanations for failure, but no good explanation for success.
Paulo Coelho
I truly believe that we have infinite levels of power that we don't even know are available to us.
Michael J. Fox
I want to keep my dreams, even bad ones, because without them, I might have nothing all night long.
Joseph Heller
I was not looking for my dreams to interpret my life, but rather for my life to interpret my dreams.
Susan Sontag
I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
Robert H. Schuller
I'd rather be a failure at something I love than a success at something I hate.
George Burns
I'm taking all the negatives in my life, and turning them into a positive.
Pitbull
I've always believed that if you put in the work, the results will come.
Michael Jordan
I've always believed that you can think positive just as well as you can think negative.
James A. Baldwin
I've got a theory that if you give 100% all of the time, somehow things will work out in the end.
Larry Bird
If we don't change, we don't grow. If we don't grow, we aren't really living.
Gail Sheehy
If we survive danger it steels our courage more than anything else.
Reinhold Niebuhr
If you could get up the courage to begin, you have the courage to succeed.
David Viscott
If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
Jim Rohn
If you realized how powerful your thoughts are, you would never think a negative thought.
Peace Pilgrim
If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
Dalai Lama
If you want to be the best, you have to do things that other people aren't willing to do.
Michael Phelps
If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
Dale Carnegie
If you want to go somewhere, it is best to find someone who has already been there.
Robert Kiyosaki
If you're going to go through hell... I suggest you come back learning something.
Drew Barrymore
Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
Albert Einstein
Imagination is the only key to the future. Without it none exists - with it all things are possible.
Ida Tarbell
Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
Carl Sagan
In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.
Dalai Lama
In order to succeed you must fail, so that you know what not to do the next time.
Anthony J. D'Angelo
The moment you give up, is the moment you let someone else win.
Kobe Bryant
Intelligence is the ability to avoid doing work, yet getting the work done.
Linus Torvalds
Intelligence recognizes what has happened. Genius recognizes what will happen.
John Ciardi
It does not take much strength to do things, but it requires great strength to decide on what to do.
Elbert Hubbard
It is better to have a fair intellect that is well used than a powerful one that is idle.
Bryant H. McGill
It is better to risk starving to death then surrender. If you give up on your dreams, what's left?
Jim Carrey
It is good to rub and polish our brain against that of others.
Michel de Montaigne
It is hard to say what the future holds, but this is probable - it won't be just like the past.
Tony Campolo
It is impossible to underrate human intelligence - beginning with one's own.
Henry Adams
It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
Tony Robbins
It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others to succeed.
Napoleon Hill
It is not enough to do your best you must know what to do, and then do your best.
W. Edwards Deming
It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
William Shakespeare
It is what we know already that often prevents us from learning.
Claude Bernard
It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
Anne Morrow Lindbergh
It takes vision and courage to create - it takes faith and courage to prove.
Owen D. Young
It's a question of whether we're going to go forward into the future, or past to the back.
Dan Quayle
It's amazing how a competitive nature can turn a negative into something positive.
Barry Mann
It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
Bill Gates
It's insecurity that is always chasing you and standing in the way of your dreams.
Vin Diesel
It's only through listening that you learn, and I never want to stop learning.
Drew Barrymore
Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
Thomas A. Edison
Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness, but it is greatness.
George Bernard Shaw
Just learning to think in another language allows you to see your own culture in a better viewpoint.
Gates McFadden
Laughter is the best medicine - unless you're diabetic, then insulin comes pretty high on the list.
Jasper Carrott
Leadership requires the courage to make decisions that will benefit the next generation.
Alan Autry
Learning by doing, peer-to-peer teaching, and computer simulation are all part of the same equation.
Nicholas Negroponte
Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Life is like playing a violin solo in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
Samuel Butler
Life is very interesting... in the end, some of your greatest pains, become your greatest strengths.
Drew Barrymore
Life only demands from you the strength that you possess. Only one feat is possible not to run away.
Dag Hammarskjold
Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Mahatma Gandhi
Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
Albert Einstein
Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
Epictetus
Making a wrong decision is understandable. Refusing to search continually for learning is not.
Phil Crosby
Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
Andre Gide
Most great people have attained their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
Napoleon Hill
Most of us have far more courage than we ever dreamed we possessed.
Dale Carnegie
Most of what we call management consists of making it difficult for people to get their work done.
Peter Drucker
My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way.
Ernest Hemingway
My best investment is my imagination, because it has never failed to bring me my greatest returns!
Randy Castillo
My imagination makes me human and makes me a fool it gives me all the world, and exiles me from it.
Ursula K. Le Guin
My success was not based so much on any great intelligence but on great common sense.
Helen Gurley Brown
Never forget that the key to the situation lies in the will and not in the imagination.
Evelyn Underhill
Never go backward. Attempt, and do it with all your might. Determination is power.
Charles Simmons
No amount of skillful invention can replace the essential element of imagination.
Edward Hopper
No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.
Jessica Savitch
No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
Robin Williams
No one ever attains success by simply doing what is required of him.
Charles Kendall Adams
No one succeeds without effort... Those who succeed owe their success to perseverance.
Ramana Maharshi
No person will make a great business who wants to do it all himself or get all the credit.
Andrew Carnegie
Nobody travels on the road to success without a puncture or two.
Navjot Singh Sidhu
Nobody's a natural. You work hard to get good and then work to get better. It's hard to stay on top.
Paul Coffey
Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
Guillaume Apollinaire
Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.
Benjamin Disraeli
One and one is two, and two and two is four, and five will get you ten if you know how to work it.
Mae West
One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
Arthur Ashe
One of the greatest and simplest tools for learning more and growing is doing more.
Washington Irving
One of the most adventurous things left us is to go to bed. For no one can lay a hand on our dreams.
E. V. Lucas
One of the rewards of success is freedom, the ability to do whatever you like.
Sting
One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
Arnold H. Glasow
One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
Benjamin Disraeli
One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
Michael Korda
One who has imagination without learning has wings without feet.
Joseph Joubert
Only through destroying myself can I discover the greater power of my spirit.
Chuck Palahniuk
Opportunities are usually disguised as hard work, so most people don't recognize them.
Ann Landers
Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
Kyle Chandler
Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and true progress.
Nicholas M. Butler
Other people's success spurs me on to do well and gives me motivation.
Nicholas Hoult
Our attitude towards others determines their attitude towards us.
Earl Nightingale
Our best successes often come after our greatest disappointments.
Henry Ward Beecher
Our business in life is not to get ahead of others, but to get ahead of ourselves.
E. Joseph Cossman
Our fatigue is often caused not by work, but by worry, frustration and resentment.
Dale Carnegie
Our imagination is the only limit to what we can hope to have in the future.
Charles Kettering
Our thoughts and imagination are the only real limits to our possibilities.
Orison Swett Marden
Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls the most massive characters are seared with scars.
Khalil Gibran
Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
Oprah Winfrey
Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.
Napoleon Hill
People don't change their behavior unless it makes a difference for them to do so.
Sharon Stone
People might not get all they work for in this world, but they must certainly work for all they get.
Frederick Douglass
Perseverance - a lowly virtue whereby mediocrity achieves an inglorious success.
Ambrose Bierce
Perseverance is not a long race it is many short races one after the other.
Walter Elliot
Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.
Newt Gingrich
Personal satisfaction is the most important ingredient of success.
Denis Waitley
Plan your work for today and every day, then work your plan.
Margaret Thatcher
Planning is bringing the future into the present so that you can do something about it now.
Alan Lakein
Plans are only good intentions unless they immediately degenerate into hard work.
Peter Drucker
Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
Swami Sivananda
Real courage is knowing what faces you and knowing how to face it.
Timothy Dalton
Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
Thomas A. Edison
Right actions in the future are the best apologies for bad actions in the past.
Tryon Edwards
Run a home like you would a small business and treat it with the same seriousness.
Anthea Turner
Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
Tony Robbins
So many of my dreams were to actually be able to make a living of what I did as a hobby.
Rick Baker
Some people are so busy learning the tricks of the trade that they never learn the trade.
Vernon Law
Someone's sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
Warren Buffett
Sometimes if you want to see a change for the better, you have to take things into your own hands.
Clint Eastwood
Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
Paul Tournier
Stay focused, go after your dreams and keep moving toward your goals.
LL Cool J
Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
Mahatma Gandhi
Stubborn and ardent clinging to one's opinion is the best proof of stupidity.
Michel de Montaigne
Style is a reflection of your attitude and your personality.
Shawn Ashmore
Success and failure are both part of life. Both are not permanent.
Shahrukh Khan
Success cannot come from standstill men. Methods change and men must change with them.
James Cash Penney
Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.
Oliver Goldsmith
Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
Winston Churchill
Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.
Confucius
Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
George Bernard Shaw
Success in life comes not from holding a good hand, but in playing a poor hand well.
Denis Waitley
Success is a journey, not a destination. The doing is often more important than the outcome.
Arthur Ashe
Success is a process, a quality of mind and way of being, an outgoing affirmation of life.
Alex Noble
Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
W. Clement Stone
Success is achieved by developing our strengths, not by eliminating our weaknesses.
Marilyn vos Savant
Success is getting what you want. Happiness is liking what you get.
H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
Success is having to worry about every damn thing in the world, except money.
Johnny Cash
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Winston Churchill
Success is not to be pursued it is to be attracted by the person you become.
Jim Rohn
Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.
Jim Rohn
Success is often the result of taking a misstep in the right direction.
Al Bernstein
Success is simple. Do what's right, the right way, at the right time.
Arnold H. Glasow
Success is sweet and sweeter if long delayed and gotten through many struggles and defeats.
Amos Bronson Alcott
Success is the maximum utilization of the ability that you have.
Zig Ziglar
Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.
Earl Nightingale
Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
Colin Powell
Success is the sum of small efforts - repeated day in and day out.
Robert Collier
Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
Arnold H. Glasow
Success or failure in business is caused more by the mental attitude even than by mental capacities.
Walter Scott
Success represents the 1% of your work which results from the 99% that is called failure.
Soichiro Honda
Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
William Feather
Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
Henry David Thoreau
Successful people recognize crisis as a time for change - from lesser to greater, smaller to bigger.
Edwin Louis Cole
Take what you can from your dreams, make them as real as anything.
Dave Matthews
Teachers can change lives with just the right mix of chalk and challenges.
Joyce Meyer
Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
Benjamin Franklin
That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
Abraham Lincoln
That was when I realised that music is the most profound, magical form of communication there is.
Lesley Garrett
The ability to convert ideas to things is the secret of outward success.
Henry Ward Beecher
The ability to simplify means to eliminate the unnecessary so that the necessary may speak.
Hans Hofmann
The best advice I ever got was that knowledge is power and to keep reading.
David Bailey
The best doctors in the world are Doctor Diet, Doctor Quiet, and Doctor Merryman.
Jonathan Swift
The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
Elbert Hubbard
The best teamwork comes from men who are working independently toward one goal in unison.
James Cash Penney
The best things in life are unexpected - because there were no expectations.
Eli Khamarov
The best thinking has been done in solitude. The worst has been done in turmoil.
Thomas A. Edison
The best way to resolve any problem in the human world is for all sides to sit down and talk.
Dalai Lama
The best work is not what is most difficult for you it is what you do best.
Jean-Paul Sartre
The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
Oprah Winfrey
The brain is like a muscle. When it is in use we feel very good. Understanding is joyous.
Carl Sagan
The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.
Peter Drucker
The first method for estimating the intelligence of a ruler is to look at the men he has around him.
Niccolo Machiavelli
The first recipe for happiness is: avoid too lengthy meditation on the past.
Andre Maurois
The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
Ralph Waldo Emerson
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
Eleanor Roosevelt
The great thing in the world is not so much to seek happiness as to earn peace and self-respect.
Thomas Huxley
The greatest happiness is to transform one's feelings into action.
Madame de Stael
The imagination equips us to perceive reality when it is not fully materialized.
Mary Richards
The key to success is to focus our conscious mind on things we desire not things we fear.
Brian Tracy
The knack of flying is learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss.
Douglas Adams
The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
Ayn Rand
The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
Woodrow Wilson
The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
Richard Bach
The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
Alice Walker
The most imaginative people are the most credulous, for them everything is possible.
Alexander Chase
The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.
Peter Drucker
The most useful piece of learning for the uses of life is to unlearn what is untrue.
Antisthenes
The only failure one should fear, is not hugging to the purpose they see as best.
George Eliot
The only limit to your impact is your imagination and commitment.
Tony Robbins
The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
Vince Lombardi
The only question to ask yourself is, how much are you willing to sacrifice to achieve this success?
Larry Flynt
The only thing I fear more than change is no change. The business of being static makes me nuts.
Twyla Tharp
The only way to predict the future is to have power to shape the future.
Eric Hoffer
The opposite for courage is not cowardice, it is conformity. Even a dead fish can go with the flow.
Jim Hightower
The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
Mary Pickford
The present was an egg laid by the past that had the future inside its shell.
Zora Neale Hurston
The problem with the future is that it keeps turning into the present.
Bill Watterson
The productivity of work is not the responsibility of the worker but of the manager.
Peter Drucker
The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
Thomas Paine
The reward for work well done is the opportunity to do more.
Jonas Salk
The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
Paramahansa Yogananda
The secret of business is to know something that nobody else knows.
Aristotle Onassis
The secret of happiness is: Find something more important than you are and dedicate your life to it.
Daniel Dennett
The secret of success is to be ready when your opportunity comes.
Benjamin Disraeli
The secret to happiness is freedom... And the secret to freedom is courage.
Thucydides
The simple act of paying positive attention to people has a great deal to do with productivity.
Tom Peters
The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
George Bernard Shaw
The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
Henry Ward Beecher
The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.
Dale Carnegie
The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
Irving Berlin
The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
Albert Einstein
The very first step towards success in any occupation is to become interested in it.
William Osler
The will to persevere is often the difference between failure and success.
David Sarnoff
The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.
Bobby Knight
The world hates change, yet it is the only thing that has brought progress.
Charles Kettering
The world needs dreamers and the world needs doers. But above all, the world needs dreamers who do.
Sarah Ban Breathnach
The worst times can be the best if you think with positive energy.
Domenico Dolce
Then I decided to draw from and on my own imagination, and everything came out perfect.
Jack Prelutsky
There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm.
Willa Cather
There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles.
Stephen Covey
There are three ingredients in the good life: learning, earning and yearning.
Christopher Morley
There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
Edith Wharton
There is a world of communication which is not dependent on words.
Mary Martin
There is always one moment in childhood when the door opens and lets the future in.
Graham Greene
There is no substitute for accurate knowledge. Know yourself, know your business, know your men.
Lee Iacocca
There is no such thing as a great talent without great will power.
Honore de Balzac
There is only one real happiness in life, and that is the happiness of creating.
Frederick Delius
There is only one rule for being a good talker - learn to listen.
Christopher Morley
There's a lot of blood, sweat, and guts between dreams and success.
Paul Bryant
There's always a learning curve, where you've got to learn what your subject is all about.
Brad Gilbert
There's no learning without trying lots of ideas and failing lots of times.
Jonathan Ive
Think little goals and expect little achievements. Think big goals and win big success.
David Joseph Schwartz
This has always been a motto of mine: Attempt the impossible in order to improve your work.
Bette Davis
Thunder is good, thunder is impressive but it is lightning that does the work.
Mark Twain
Time is neutral and does not change things. With courage and initiative, leaders change things.
Jesse Jackson
Time is the scarcest resource and unless it is managed nothing else can be managed.
Peter Drucker
To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream not only plan, but also believe.
Anatole France
To achieve, you need thought. You have to know what you are doing and that's real power.
Ayn Rand
To change a habit, make a conscious decision, then act out the new behavior.
Maxwell Maltz
To educate the intelligence is to expand the horizon of its wants and desires.
James Russell Lowell
To give anything less than your best, is to sacrifice the gift.
Steve Prefontaine
To listen well is as powerful a means of communication and influence as to talk well.
John Marshall
To treat your facts with imagination is one thing, to imagine your facts is another.
John Burroughs
Today knowledge has power. It controls access to opportunity and advancement.
Peter Drucker
Too much work, too much vacation, too much of any one thing is unsound.
Walter Annenberg
True courage is being afraid, and going ahead and doing your job anyhow, that's what courage is.
Norman Schwarzkopf
True happiness comes from the joy of deeds well done, the zest of creating things new.
Antoine de Saint-Exupery
Trust that little voice in your head that says 'Wouldn't it be interesting if...' And then do it.
Duane Michals
Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
Albert Einstein
Try to learn something about everything and everything about something.
Thomas Huxley
Try, try, try, and keep on trying is the rule that must be followed to become an expert in anything.
W. Clement Stone
Unity is strength... when there is teamwork and collaboration, wonderful things can be achieved.
Mattie Stepanek
We all have big changes in our lives that are more or less a second chance.
Harrison Ford
We are infected by our own misunderstanding of how our own minds work.
Kevin Kelly
We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
George Bernard Shaw
We awaken in others the same attitude of mind we hold toward them.
Elbert Hubbard
We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
Tony Robbins
We can chart our future clearly and wisely only when we know the path which has led to the present.
Adlai E. Stevenson
We can live with lots of things, but we can't live without imagination, we can't live without hope.
Ariel Dorfman
We don't have an eternity to realize our dreams, only the time we are here.
Susan Taylor
We should measure welfare's success by how many people leave welfare, not by how many are added.
Ronald Reagan
What I know is, is that if you do work that you love, and the work fulfills you, the rest will come.
Oprah Winfrey
What is important is to believe in something so strongly that you're never discouraged.
Salma Hayek
What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
Henry David Thoreau
When you do something best in life, you don't really want to give that up - and for me it's tennis.
Roger Federer
When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.
Natalie Gulbis
When you forgive, you in no way change the past - but you sure do change the future.
Bernard Meltzer
When you start to develop your powers of empathy and imagination, the whole world opens up to you.
Susan Sarandon
Whenever I hear, 'It can't be done,' I know I'm close to success.
Michael Flatley
Whether it's the best of times or the worst of times, it's the only time we've got.
Art Buchwald
While knowledge may provide useful point of reference, it cannot become a force to guide the future.
Herbie Hancock
Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times.
Niccolo Machiavelli
Win as if you were used to it, lose as if you enjoyed it for a change.
Ralph Waldo Emerson
Winners make a habit of manufacturing their own positive expectations in advance of the event.
Brian Tracy
Within our dreams and aspirations we find our opportunities.
Sugar Ray Leonard
Without failure there is no sweetness in success. There's no understanding of it.
Glenn Beck
Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.
George Allen, Sr.
Work while you work, play while you play - this is a basic rule of repressive self-discipline.
Theodor Adorno
Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow. It empties today of its strength.
Corrie Ten Boom
Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
Ralph Waldo Emerson
You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
C. S. Lewis
You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
Ted Turner
You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
Flip Wilson
You cannot climb the ladder of success dressed in the costume of failure.
Zig Ziglar
You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.
Richard Branson
You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
Marcus Aurelius
You might well remember that nothing can bring you success but yourself.
Napoleon Hill
You only live once - but if you work it right, once is enough.
Joe E. Lewis
You'll be much more successful if you follow your dreams and follow your passions.
Jay Weatherill
Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
Zig Ziglar
Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
William S. Burroughs
Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
Bill Gates
Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go they merely determine where you start.
Nido Qubein
Your success depends mainly upon what you think of yourself and whether you believe in yourself.
William J. H. Boetcker
